page.title: 11EDINBANE-HEBRIDEAN TOWNSHIP
page.content: Edinbane is a small crofting township on the Isle of Skye off north-west Scotland. It lies at the head of Loch Greshornish, fourteen miles from Portree on the Portree-Dunvegan road. The houses are situated round the head of the loch and in a line along the hill-face with the croft land running in strips down to the loch. Behind the croft houses is an area of common grazing land, rough grazing merging with heather. Surrounding Edinbane are areas of grass and rolling heather moorland rising to 500ft. The soil is acid and cannot be drained easily because of ingneous rock formations. This has led to the formation of peat bogs. Where there is good drainage, oats and potatoes are grown, but wet weather can ruin the oats. Loch Greshornish is a sea loch, part of Loch Snizort.
